concise_definition: v. 爆炸, 爆裂, 激增; n. 爆炸

definitions.explanation_en: To burst violently and noisily, often due to rapid expansion of gases, as in a bomb or pressure vessel.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由于气体迅速膨胀而发生猛烈且响亮的破裂，如炸弹或压力容器的爆炸。
definitions.example_en: The fireworks exploded in a brilliant display of colors.
definitions.example_cn: 烟花在空中炸开，呈现出绚丽的色彩。

definitions.explanation_en: To suddenly increase or rise at a very rapid rate, often beyond normal limits.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某事物突然以极快的速度增加或上升，常超出正常范围。
definitions.example_en: Popularity of the app exploded after the viral social media post.
definitions.example_cn: 这款应用在社交媒体热传后用户数量激增。

definitions.explanation_en: To lose one's temper suddenly and violently, often expressing anger in an uncontrolled way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指突然失控地发怒，以激烈的方式表达愤怒。
definitions.example_en: She exploded when she found out her car had been towed.
definitions.example_cn: 她发现车被拖走时顿时暴怒。

definitions.explanation_en: A sudden, violent bursting or outburst, often used metaphorically to describe a dramatic event or reaction.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指突然而猛烈的爆发或喷发，常用于比喻性地描述戏剧性事件或强烈反应。
definitions.example_en: The explosion of laughter filled the room as the comedian told the punchline.
definitions.example_cn: 当喜剧演员讲到笑点时，房间里爆发出一阵大笑。

comparison.analysis: “Burst” (爆裂) 强调因内部压力导致的突然破裂，常用于液体、气球或情绪的释放，但不一定伴随巨大声响或破坏性。而 “explode” 更强调剧烈、有冲击力的爆炸，常涉及能量释放和碎片飞散，破坏性更强。
“Erupt” (喷发) 常用于火山、情绪或冲突的突然爆发，带有自然或长期积累后释放的意味，多用于地质或抽象情境（如战争、愤怒）。而 “explode” 更强调瞬间的物理性或情绪性爆发，常具突发性和不可预测性。
“Inflate” (充气/膨胀) 指通过注入气体使物体体积增大，是一个渐进、可控的过程，通常无破坏性。而 “explode” 是膨胀失控后的极端结果，是破坏性的终点，而非过程。
